wmi_2026.title: The WMI & 2026 World Series (The Modern Standard)
wmi_2026.subtitle: End-to-End Intelligence
wmi_2026.includes: WMI V12, V11, V10, SC Model, Macrostiff
wmi_2026.vibe: These are the cutting edge. 'WMI' likely stands for 'World Model Iteration.' These models use the latest End-to-End (E2E) architecture, meaning they 'see' the world more like a human. They understand 3D scenes, stop signs, intersections, and road edges - not just painted lines. WMI V12 is the current flagship. It's the smartest at complex urban scenarios but can feel slightly 'loose' on straight highways because it's constantly micro-adjusting like a human driver would. If you drive mostly city streets with stop signs and turns, this is your series.
wmi_2026.bestFor: Daily driving in 2026. They balance smoothness with intelligence.
wmi_2026.recommendation: Start with WMI V12. If it feels too 'wiggly' on highways, try Macrostiff for tighter steering feel.

aggressive.title: The Aggressive Series
aggressive.subtitle: Traffic Warriors
aggressive.includes: Dark Souls Model, Dark Souls v2, Firehose
aggressive.vibe: High-performance, high-attention. Dark Souls is named because it's 'unforgiving' or 'hardcore.' Expect tighter following distances, faster acceleration, and sharper turns. It drives like a human who is in a hurry but still safe. Great for heavy trucks (F-150s, Sierras) that need authoritative inputs to move their mass. The Firehose model is the raw developer feed - it changes almost daily. Some days it's brilliant, other days it has bugs. Only for adventurous testers who don't mind occasional weirdness.
aggressive.bestFor: Heavy traffic commuters who don't want people cutting them off.
aggressive.recommendation: Dark Souls v2 for trucks and SUVs. Only try Firehose if you enjoy living on the edge.

comfort.title: The Comfort & Smooth Series
comfort.subtitle: Passenger Friendly
comfort.includes: Down to Ride (DTR), Space Lab, Kumars Vibe
comfort.vibe: Relaxed and passenger-friendly. Down to Ride (DTR) is famous for being 'wife-approved.' It prioritizes gentle braking and slow turns over perfect lane centering. Kumars Vibe is custom-tuned for a specific car setup but became popular because it removes the 'robotic' feel - very natural steering transitions. These models are perfect for road trips where passengers might get motion sick from abrupt steering corrections.
comfort.bestFor: Road trips with family or passengers who get motion sick.
comfort.recommendation: Start with Down to Ride v6. It's the community's go-to for passenger comfort.

tomb_raider.title: The Tomb Raider / Trash Folder (TR) Series
tomb_raider.subtitle: Hidden Gems
tomb_raider.vibe: These are experimental training runs. Despite the name, some are hidden gems! Tomb Raider 16 (Trash Folder 16) was a community favorite for a long time due to its unique handling of highway curves. It felt like driving 'on rails.' These models often have quirks but can surprise you with excellent performance in specific scenarios. Worth trying if you drive curvy roads.
tomb_raider.bestFor: Adventurous users looking for unique driving characteristics.
tomb_raider.recommendation: Tomb Raider 16 for winding backroads. Don't let the 'Trash Folder' name scare you!

legacy.title: The Legacy Legends
legacy.subtitle: Old Reliable
legacy.includes: Recertified Herbalist, North Dakota, Blue Diamond
legacy.vibe: The 'Old Guard.' These models are from 2023-2024. They are less 'smart' (bad at stop signs) but incredible at highway lane keeping. Recertified Herbalist is the 'Gold Standard' of stability. North Dakota is famous for its STIFF steering - it hugs the center of the lane and refuses to move. WD40 'lubricated' this stiffness for smoother inputs. Blue Diamond excels in rain and poor lane markings. These are the 'Toyota Camry' of models - boring, reliable, and rock solid.
legacy.bestFor: Highway-focused driving with rock-solid lane centering.
legacy.recommendation: Recertified Herbalist for long road trips. North Dakota if you want maximum stiffness.

categories.name: Favorites
categories.description: The most popular models for daily driving right now. Community-tested and approved.

models.name: WMI V12
models.consensus: The current flagship and daily driver for most users in 2026. Highest intelligence for complex scenarios like intersections, stop signs, and tight urban turns.
models.note: Can feel slightly 'loose' on straight highways.

models.name: Dark Souls Model v2
models.consensus: The 'unforgiving' model, refined. Tighter following distance, faster reactions, sharper turns. Excellent for larger vehicles that need authority.

models.name: Nevada Model
models.consensus: The 'neutral' benchmark. If a new model feels weird, Nevada is what you compare it to. Well-balanced between smooth and responsive.

models.name: Down to Ride v6
models.consensus: The legendary 'Wife Approved' model. Sacrifices perfect lane centering for passenger comfort. Won't jerk the wheel; gently drifts into turns.
models.note: Perfect for road trips with family.

categories.name: WMI 2026
categories.description: Latest End-to-End architecture. Understands 3D scenes, stop signs, and complex intersections.

models.name: WMI V11
models.consensus: Slightly more stable than V12 on straightaways. Good fallback if V12 feels too jittery.

models.name: WMI v10
models.consensus: Well-tested mid-generation model. A solid choice if V11/V12 have issues on your specific vehicle.

models.name: SC Model
models.consensus: Likely 'Space Cat' or 'Stable Control' variant. Testing new stability algorithms.
models.note: Worth trying if you want something different.

models.name: WMI V9
models.consensus: Mid-generation iteration with good stability. Superseded by V10+ but still reliable.

models.name: WMI V8
models.consensus: Early 2026 build that established the foundation. Still functional for conservative E2E users.

models.name: WMI V7
models.consensus: New Year's release that kick-started the 2026 WMI series. Historical significance.

models.name: Macrostiff Model
models.consensus: World Model tuned for STIFFER steering response. If WMI V12 feels too 'wiggly', this locks it down.
models.note: Great for vehicles with loose steering racks.

categories.name: Aggressive
categories.description: For drivers who want performance, tight following, or bleeding-edge features.

models.name: Dark Souls Model
models.consensus: Original 'unforgiving' model. Still popular for assertive driving. Less refined than v2 but raw character.

models.name: Firehose Model
models.consensus: The raw developer feed. Changes almost daily. HIGH RISK, HIGH REWARD.
models.note: One day it's perfect, the next it might be buggy.

models.name: Planplus v2
models.consensus: Testing a new lateral planner algorithm. Very experimental - for developers and testers.

models.name: Neurips Driving Model v2
models.consensus: Model presented at NeurIPS AI conference. Showcase technology with academic focus.

models.name: Neurips Driving Model
models.consensus: Original conference model. Interesting for research purposes.

models.name: Steam Powered Model
models.consensus: Experimental longitudinal (gas/brake) behavior. Unique acceleration and braking feel.

categories.name: Comfort
categories.description: Passenger-friendly models. Smooth inputs over precision. Perfect for road trips.

models.name: Down to Ride v5
models.consensus: Previous DTR version. Still smooth and comfortable, slightly less refined than v6.

models.name: Space Lab 3
models.consensus: Space-themed smooth model with gentle transitions and a relaxed feel.

models.name: Space Lab 2
models.consensus: Earlier Space Lab iteration. Good baseline comfort.

models.name: Kumars Vibe
models.consensus: Custom tune that removes the 'robotic' feeling. Very natural, human-like steering inputs.
models.note: Community favorite for natural driving feel.

models.name: UV + DTR Model
models.consensus: Merge of 'Unlimited Vision' and 'Down to Ride.' Combines visibility with comfort.

models.name: Duck Amigo
models.consensus: Legacy comfort model with very soft inputs. Passenger-focused.

categories.name: Tomb Raider
categories.description: Experimental 'Trash Folder' runs. Hidden gems for curves. Don't let the name scare you!

models.name: Tomb Raider 16
models.consensus: CULT CLASSIC! Often called 'Trash Folder 16.' BEST curve handling of any 2025 model.

models.name: Tomb Raider 15
models.consensus: Predecessor to TR16. Good curve handling but slightly less refined.

models.name: Le Tomb Raider 14
models.consensus: French-named variant. An experimental fork with unique characteristics.

models.name: Tomb Raider 14
models.consensus: Standard TR14 iteration. Laid groundwork for TR15 and TR16.

models.name: Tomb Raider 13
models.consensus: Earlier TR series. Foundation for curve-handling characteristics.

models.name: Aggressive TR
models.consensus: Aggressive tune of the TR series. Combines curve handling with assertive inputs.

models.name: Tomb Raider 7
models.consensus: Early TR series. Foundation for later versions.

models.name: Vegetarian Filet o Fish
models.consensus: Gentle braking profile optimized for hybrids. Maximizes regenerative braking.

models.name: Kerrygold Driving
models.consensus: Named after the butter brand - 'Smooth as butter.' Very gentle inputs.

models.name: Liquid Crystal Driving
models.consensus: Experimental TR-era model with unique steering characteristics.

models.name: Secret Good Openpilot
models.consensus: The name says it all - a hidden gem! Surprisingly good all-around performance.

models.name: Simple Plan Driving
models.consensus: Simplified planning model. Reliable and predictable behavior.

categories.name: 2025 Models
categories.description: The 'World Model' development era. Highly varied performance.

models.name: WMI v6
models.consensus: Late 2025 iteration bridging to 2026 series. More stable than early WMI versions.

models.name: WMI v5
models.consensus: Mid-development World Model. Well-tested by the community.

models.name: WMI v4
models.consensus: Earlier stable World Model. Less intelligent but proven reliable.

models.name: WMI v3
models.consensus: Third iteration of World Model. Foundation for stable releases.

models.name: WMI2
models.consensus: Second World Model Iteration. Early E2E experiment that showed promise.

models.name: WMI
models.consensus: The ORIGINAL World Model Iteration. Started the E2E revolution in Sunnypilot.

models.name: Planplus Model
models.consensus: Lateral planner experiment. Predecessor to Planplus v2.

models.name: ST Model
models.consensus: Short-term planning model. Focused on immediate path decisions.

models.name: Cool GWM
models.consensus: Generic World Model variant created by the community.

models.name: GWM V9
models.consensus: Generic World Model version 9. Standard performance.

models.name: The Cool Peoples Model v3
models.consensus: Third iteration of the community-driven model. Active development.

models.name: The Cool Peoples Model v2
models.consensus: Second version of the community model. Improved on feedback.

models.name: The Cool Peoples Model
models.consensus: Original community-driven model. 'By the people, for the people.'

models.name: Nuggets in Digon
models.consensus: Meme-named experimental training run. Inconsistent but fun.

models.name: North Nevada Model V2
models.consensus: Updated version of the stable benchmark. Refined lane centering.

models.name: North Nevada Model
models.consensus: Early stable benchmark. Established the 'neutral' baseline.

models.name: gNM v8
models.consensus: Generic Neural Model version 8. Solid baseline performance.

models.name: gNM v6
models.consensus: Generic Neural Model version 6. Less refined than v8.

models.name: gNM v5
models.consensus: Generic Neural Model version 5. Mid-stage development.

models.name: gNM Model v3
models.consensus: Early Generic Neural Model. Historical interest.

models.name: Fly By Wire
models.consensus: Named after aircraft control systems. Smooth, filtered feel like flying.

models.name: Falling Phoenix
models.consensus: Experimental merge. Unique steering some users love.

models.name: SP Vikander Model
models.consensus: Sunnypilot-specific tune. Optimized for this fork.

models.name: Filet o Fish
models.consensus: Original 'fish' model. Smooth braking profile. Historical significance.

categories.name: Legacy
categories.description: The 'Old Guard.' Rock solid highway stability. Less 'smart' but incredible lane keeping.

models.name: Recertified Herbalist
models.consensus: THE most reliable legacy model. The 'Toyota Camry' of models - boring, predictable, rock solid.
models.note: UNSHAKEABLE on highways. Bad at stop signs.

models.name: North Dakota
models.consensus: Known for SUPER STIFF steering. Hugs center lane and REFUSES to move. On rails.
models.note: Can feel robotic but incredibly stable.

models.name: WD40
models.consensus: Named because it 'lubricated' North Dakota's stiffness. Best of both worlds.

models.name: Notre Dame
models.consensus: Solid legacy model. Named after the cathedral - built to last.

models.name: Certified Herbalist v2
models.consensus: Predecessor to Recertified Herbalist. Still good but less polished.

models.name: Blue Diamond v2
models.consensus: The 'VISION KING' of older models. EXCELLENT in rain or poor lane markings.
models.note: Can see lanes that other models miss.

models.name: Farmville
models.consensus: Very old model from 2023. Mostly deprecated.
models.note: Historical interest only. Don't use for daily driving.
